contentrichtext.text: '''Avon County Council''' was the [[county council]] of the non-metropolitan county of [[Avon (county)|Avon]] in south west England. It came into its powers on 1 April 1974 and was abolished on 1 April 1996 at the same time as the county. The county council was based in [[Bristol]] at [[Avon House, Bristol|Avon House]] and [[Avon House North]]. It was replaced with four authorities: [[Bristol City Council]], [[South Gloucestershire Council]], [[North Somerset Council]] and [[Bath and North East Somerset Council]]. {{Former county councils of England}} [[Category:Former county councils of England]] [[Category:History of Gloucestershire]] [[Category:History of Somerset]] [[Category:1974 establishments in England]] [[Category:1996 disestablishments]] {{politics-stub}}
